reviewText: Now we have Mark Sloan and his son Steve sharing a beach house and most meetings of the cast members to talk over strategy happens there instead of in Mark's hospital office... in fact Mark mentions being semi-retired in this season...  and Amanda is pregnant and has her baby... so story lines continue with the cast as they solve a mystery each week plus Norman has his own agenda going on....
summary: I Love it  - Like Jessie in this season

reviewText: Sorry...I am obviously in the minority but the 3rd season is a downgrade from the first season and even the second, which I don't feel is as good as the first.  Charlie Schlater's acting makes Scott Baio look like Sir Lawrence Olivier.  As hard as it was to accept Baio as "Doctor Jack Stewart", it's even harder to accept Schlater.As I said in my review title, Dick Van Dyke is great, but even he can't overcome the less than stellar story lines of this third season and the plausability of Schlater as a doctor.  I won't be purchasing any more DVD's from this series.
summary: The charms of Dick Van Dyke only go so far

reviewText: The Diagnosis Murder series is a must-see for Dick Van Dyke fans.  I have the first three seasons and am looking forward to the 4th season being released on DVD.  Van Dyke carries the show with his humor and antics, but there is a good plot support system and serious element to the investigations.  Highly recommended!
summary: A MUST for Dick Van Dyke fans

reviewText: Diagnosis Murder is one of the best mystery shows in the last 30 years.  I always thought that Dick Van Dyke was a great actor both in the movies and on TV.  He really makes this show along with Barry, his son.  I'm looking forward to the rest of the seasons as long as they're all uncut and complete.  Bring them on!!!

reviewText: Season 3 brings more mystery and suspense as Dr. Mark Sloan of community general hospital investigates along with his son.. A great series, keep rolling out these seasons Paramount! This show deserves 10 stars out of 10 not 1 out of 5, cough cough.. If you're looking to spend a good 45 minutes with excellent dynamic characters then this is the set for you!

reviewText: Murder mystery shows can be so predictable..quirkly lead character, good cast, good ensemble, good writing....And then there's Diagnosis Murder.  Quite easily one of the best of the soft core murder mystery shows, Season three gave us no Jack and Delores.  They added to the program with their unique personalities, but with the addition of Charlie Schlatter (Travis) the cast undergoes a transformation.The writing is still top notch, but like any show, they can take a while to build a strong cast and following.  This is the beginning, but the first two seasons are no slouches either!Give me DM over CSI anyday!Tim Lasiuta
summary: Keep on Solving Dr....keep on solving...
